shapes

Class Shape

  • java.lang.Object
    • shapes.Shape
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable, Translateable, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArbitrarySimplePolygon, Ellipse

    public abstract class Shape
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, Drawable, Translateable
    A class to represent any shape to be used in the geometry drawer. Has a position in standard cartesian coordinates, which should be transformed according to the drawer's coordinate system when drawing to screen coordinates. Shapes and subclasses should be immutable, except for position.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • checkDimension

        public static void checkDimension(int dimension)
        Method to check whether a dimension is negative or not. If the dimension is valid (non-negative), this method does nothing. Otherwise, a NegativeDimensionException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        dimension - The dimension to check.

      • draw

        public abstract void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws this object onto the specified Graphics object.

        The Shape should be drawn such that the coordinates of the top left corner of the bounding box is equal to the coordinates specified in the x and y attributes of this Shape.

        Specified by:
        draw in interface Drawable
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object to draw to.

      • contains

        public abstract boolean contains(java.awt.Point p)
        Returns whether or not the given point can be considered within this Shape.
        Parameters:
        p - The Point to check for insideness.
        Returns:
        boolean, whether or not the point can be considered inside this Shape.

      • calculateArea

        protected abstract double calculateArea()
        Calculates and returns the area of this Shape. It is almost certainly a better idea to use getArea() instead, as that stores the result so the calculation only occurs once.
        Returns:
        double, the area of this Shape.

      • calculatePerimeter

        protected abstract double calculatePerimeter()
        Calculates and returns the perimeter of this Shape. It is almost certainly a better idea to use getPerimeter() instead, as that stores the result so the calculation only occurs once.
        Returns:
        double, the perimeter of this Shape.

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Gets the x coordinate of this Shape. The x coordinate is the leftmost (smallest) x coordinate this Shape covers, i.e. the x coordinate of this Shape's bounding box left edge.
        Returns:
        int, the x coordinate of this Shape.

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Gets the y coordinate of this Shape. The y coordinate is the topmost (largest) y coordinate this Shape covers, i.e. the y coordinate of this Shape's bounding box top edge.
        Returns:
        int, the y coordinate of this Shape.

      • getArea

        public double getArea()
        Gets the area of this Shape. The area is calculated and stored if it hasn't been calculated before.
        Returns:
        double, the area of this Shape.

      • getPerimeter

        public double getPerimeter()
        Gets the perimeter of this Shape. The perimeter is calculated and stored if it hasn't been calculated before.
        Returns:
        double, the perimeter of this Shape.
